intro: Thomsonaria candidissima, commonly known as the white thomsonia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture. Thomsonaria candidissima is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
